    Gocator 2530 and and 3506 is a high-performance 3D smart sensor designed for industrial automation and quality control applications. It features a built-in web interface for easy setup and configuration, making it ideal for inline inspection tasks. The sensor uses laser triangulation technology to capture high-resolution 3D point cloud data of the target object, allowing for detailed surface analysis and measurement. With its compact design and versatile capabilities, the Gocator 2530 and 3506 is well-suited for a wide range of industries, including automotive, electronics

    Features of Gocator 2530 and 3506

    • Up To 100 Mm Field Of View
    • 28 Microns X Resolution
    • 0.5 Microns Z Repeatability
    • 10,000 Profiles Per Second Including 3d Measurement
    • Setup & Control Via Web Browser Or Sdk
    • Built-In Tools, No Programming
    • Extend With Gdk And Gomax

    Technical Specifications of Gocator 2530

    Type 3D Sensor
    Data Points Profile 1920
    Resolution X (µm) (Profile Data Interval) 28.0 - 54.0
    Repeatability Z (µm) 0.5
    Clearance Distance (CD) (mm) 40
    Measurement Range (MR) (mm) 80
    Field of View (FOV) (mm) Field of View (FOV) (mm) 48 - 100

    Technical Specifications of Gocator 3506

    Type 3D Sensor
    Resolution X (µm) (Profile Data Interval) 0.020 (CE) mm - 0.025 (FE) mm
    Repeatability Z (µm) 2.0 um
    Clearance Distance (CD) (mm) 87.0 mm / 3.43 inches
    Measurement Range (MR) (mm) 25.0 mm / 0.98 inches
    Field of View (FOV) (mm) 27.0 x 45.0 mm - 30.0 x 45.0 mm
    1.06 x 1.77 inches - 1.18 x 1.77 inches

    Software Overview and Requirements - GoSDK

    The Gocator Software Development Kit (GoSDK) includes open-source software libraries and documentation that can be used to programmatically access and control Gocator sensors.

    Features Of GoSDK

    • Sensor Control: APIs for configuring sensor settings such as exposure, resolution, and measurement parameters.
    • Data Acquisition: Functions for capturing 3D point cloud data from the sensor.
    • Data Processing: Tools for processing and analyzing 3D point cloud data, including filtering, alignment, and measurement functions.
    • Integration: Support for integrating Gocator sensors into existing applications and systems, including PLCs and robotic systems.
    • Visualization: Functions for visualizing 3D point cloud data in real-time or offline for analysis and inspection.
    • Calibration: Tools for calibrating sensors and correcting for distortion or misalignment in the captured data.
    • Networking: APIs for communicating with Gocator sensors over Ethernet or other network protocols.

    Hardware and Software Requirements

    Hardware / System Requirements:

    • Intel i7 5960X
    • 16 GB RAM
    • Windows 8.1 Pro
    • Graphics Card - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 - 12 GB DDR5 RAM

    Software Requirements:

    • GoSDK
    • Microsoft Visual Studio for C++ IDE for development
    • Additional software or libraries required by the SDK or application

    Additional Requirements:

    This version of Microsoft Visual Studio works best with Internet Explorer 10 or higher. If Internet Explorer 10 is not installed on your computer, some features might not work as expected

    Installing GoSDK Software

    This topic explains how to install the GoSDK for Windows. To get the latest version of the Gocator SDK package, go to this link, choose your product from the Product Downloads section, and download it from the Download Centre.

    To download the SDK:

    1. Go to the Manage page and click on the Support category
    2. Next to Software Development Kit (SDK), click Download
    3. Choose the location for the SDK on the client computer.

    DRIVER DEVELOPMENT

    Introduction to driver development for the device

    Users of the Gocator 2530 and 3506 Interface Software Suite may want to build their own C applications without the need to purchase an integrated development environment (IDE). This application note describes an alternative way to build C applications using free Microsoft Visual Studio.

    Microsoft stopped providing single-language programming environments. Therefore, it is necessary to install the complete edition of free Microsoft Visual Studio. This will automatically enable you to build C applications with .NET languages such as C# and Visual Basic (*) as well, which are also supported by the GoSDK Software Suite.

    The following two free Microsoft Visual Studio tools are applicable to build pylon-based C applications:

    • Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop does not provide the x64 native compiler. However, you can build 64-bit executables just fine using the x86-x64 cross compiler running on WOW64.
    • Microsoft Visual Studio Community is the successor of the Express Edition starting with the 2015 release, but is also available in a 2013 release. It is comparable in its functionality to the full Professional Edition.

    To get an overview of the Visual C features available in Microsoft Visual Studio, refer to the following link .

    Steps To Be Carried Out

    To build powerful Windows GoSDK applications carry out the following steps:

    1. Install the GoSDK.
    2. Install the desired free Microsoft Visual Studio tool.
    3. Prepare the C projects.
    4. Run the project.

    Driver Implementation

    The following drivers or APIs are developed and tested

    1. GetDeviceDetails
    2. OpenDevice
    3. CloseDevice
    4. ChangeAlias
    5. Load Program
    6. Select Program
    7. Save Program
    8. Get Raw 3D data
    9. Get Judgement Output
    10. Start Storage
    11. Stop Storage
    12. Clear Storage
    13. Get Stored Values
    14. GoStartData
    15. GoStopData

    gRPC API’s Description for Gocator 2530 and 3506

    1. GetDeviceDetails

      Description for GetDeviceDetails API: Retrieves detailed information about the connected Gocator, including its configuration and status.

      RPC Command : rpc GetDeviceDetails(.generic. CommandRequest) returns (.generic.GenericDeviceModel) {}

      Request:
      message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response:
      message GenericDeviceModel{
      string instance_id = 1;
      string device_alias = 2;
      DeviceType device_type = 3;
      DeviceModel device_model_name = 4;
      optional DeviceStatus device_status = 5;
      string ipaddr = 6;
      string mac_addr = 7;
      google.protobuf.Value conn_handle=8;
      string port_name = 9;
      int64 port_address = 10;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 11;
      }
      Parameter Description
      instance_id New instance for the device in the enumeration
      device_alias device_alias Unique identifier (alphanumeric) for every device in the enumeration
      device_type device_type Indicates the type of device like Motion stage, Safety Controller etc (defined below in the DeviceType enum)
      device_model_name Indicate the model name for each device (define below in the DeviceModel enum)
      device_status device_status indicate whether the device is online , offline or not reachable (define below in the device status enum)
      ipaddr indicate the ipaddress of the device
      mac_addr mac_addr indicate the mac address of the device
      Conn_handle Conn_handle Handle object to keep the device open
      port_name Port name
      port_address port_address Port address
      cmd_response cmd_response Indicates command response that describes API response code and its description (Defined below in CommandResponse)
      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GetDeviceDetails GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetDeviceDetails: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias Name of the device

    2. OpenDevice

      Description for OpenDevice API: To Connect to the Gocator 2350.

      RPC Command : rpc OpenDevice(.generic.CommandIPRequest) returns(.generic.GenericDeviceModel) {}
      Request:
      message CommandIPRequest{
      string ip_address = 1;
      string com=2;
      int64 port_address=3;
      int32 device_id = 4;
      string file_path = 5;
      int64 device_model =6;
      optional string device_alias=7;
      int32 axis =8;
      }
      Parameter Description
      ip_address ip_address IP Address of the Device
      com COM Port Address of the Device with serial communication (ex. COM1)
      port_address Port address of the device with serial communication (ex. 1)
      Response
      message GenericDeviceModel{
      string instance_id = 1;
      string device_alias = 2;
      DeviceType device_type = 3;
      DeviceModel device_model_name = 4;
      optional DeviceStatus device_status = 5;
      string ipaddr = 6;
      string mac_addr = 7;
      google.protobuf.Value conn_handle=8;
      string port_name = 9;
      int64 port_address = 10;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 11;
      }
      Parameter Description
      instance_id instance_id New instance for the device in the enumeration
      device_alias device_alias Unique identifier (alphanumeric) for every device in the enumeration
      device_type device_type Indicates the type of device like Motion stage, Safety Controller etc (defined below in the DeviceType enum)
      device_model_name device_model_name Indicate the model name for each device (define below in the DeviceModel enum)
      device_status device_status indicate whether the device is online , offline or not reachable (define below in the device status enum)
      ipaddr ipaddr indicate the ipaddress of the device
      mac_addr mac_addr indicate the mac address of the device
      Conn_handle Conn_handle Handle object to keep the device open
      port_name Port name
      port_address Port address
      cmd_response cmd_response Indicates command response that describes API response code and its description (Defined below in CommandResponse)

      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      ParameterDescription
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py OpenDevice 192.168.1.10 GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command
      • OpenDevice: OpenDevice is the API called to the Gocator 2350 through CLI Command to connect.
      • 192.168.1.10: IP Address of the device
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the device

    3. CloseDevice

      Description for CloseDevice API: Disconnects from the Gocator, releasing all resources and deleting associated handlers to ensure a clean shutdown.
      RPC Command: rpc CloseDevice(.generic.CommandRequest) returns(.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py CloseDevice GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • CloseDevice: API called to Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the device

    4. ChangeAlias

      Description for ChangeAlias API: Updates the alias of the device, allowing it to be referenced by a new identifier.
      RPC Command: rpc changeAlias(ChangeAliasRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {} Request: message ChangeAliasRequest{
      string current_alias=1;
      string new_alias=2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      current_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      new_alias The device_alias to change to
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py changeAlias current_alias new_alias

      Description for CLI Command:
      • ChangeAlias: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command to get new alias name
      • current_alias: The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      • new_alias: The device_alias to change to

    5. Loadprogram

      Description for API: Loads the specified program onto the gocator sensor and makes it the live job
      RPC Command: rpc LoadProgram(stream LoadProgramCommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message SelectProgramCommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      bytes data = 2;
      string file_name = 3; }
      Parameter Description
      data The program file contents
      file_name The name of the program to be loaded on the Gocator
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python3 gocator.py LoadProgram GOCATOR_1 newjob.job

      Description for CLI Command:
      • LoadProgram: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the device
      • newjob.job: The program that has to be uploaded onto the device

    6. SelectProgram

      Description for API: Selects the specified program already present in the gocator sensor live job.
      RPC Command: rpc SelectProgram(SelectProgramCommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message SelectProgramCommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      string file_name = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      file_name The program filename to be saved as live program
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py SelectProgram GOCATOR_1 newjob.job

      Description for CLI Command:
      • SelectProgram: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device
      • newjob.job: The program that has to be selected as live program on the device

    7. SaveProgram

      Description for API: Retrieves the current live program from the gocator device and streams over gRPC
      RPC Command: rpc SaveProgram(SaveProgramCommandRequest) returns (stream SaveProgramCommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message SaveProgramCommandResponse {
      string resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      bytes data = 3;
      string file_name = 4;
      int64 file_size = 5;
      }
      Parameter Description
      data The file contents of the program from Gocator
      file_name The name of the program file
      file_size Program file size
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py SaveProgram GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • SaveProgram: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Aliased Name for Gocator

    8. GetRaw3dData

      Description for API: Gets the point cloud data from the device and streams over gRPC
      RPC Command: rpc GetRaw3dData(.generic.CommandRequest) returns (stream RawDataResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message RawDataResponse {
      bytes data = 1;
      string file_name = 2;
      int64 file_size = 3;
      .generic.CommandResponse cmd_response = 4;
      }
      Parameter Description
      data File contents of the point cloud data
      file-name Name under which the file has to be saved
      File_size File size
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GetRaw3dData GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetRaw3dData: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    9. GetJudgementOutput

      Description for API: Gets the judgement data from the device and streams over gRPC
      RPC Command: rpc GetJudgementOutput(.generic.CommandRequest) returns (JudgementDataResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message JudgementDataResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      GocatorDecisionList gocator_decisionL_list = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      gocator_decisionL_list Decision data list
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GetJudgementOutput GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetJudgementOutput:API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    10. StartStorage

      Description for API: Start Storaging the current live program from the gocator device and streams it over grpc
      RPC Command: rpc StartStorage (StorageDataCommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message StorageDataCommandRequest {
      string file_name=1;
      .generic.CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      file_name Filename(.rec) under which the data has to be stored
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py StartStorage GOCATOR_1 gocator_storage_data.rec

      Description for CLI Command:
      • StartStorage: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    11. StopStorage

      Description for API: Stop the storage (To be run after StartStorage API)
      RPC Command: rpc StopStorage (.generic.CommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py StopStorage GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • StopStorage: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    12. ClearStorage

      Description for API: Clear all the files on the device storage
      RPC Command: rpc ClearStorage (.generic.CommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py ClearStorage GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • ClearStorage: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    13. GetStoredValues

      Description for API: Gets the stored data from the device and streams over gRPC.
      RPC Command: rpc GetStoredValues (StorageDataCommandRequest) returns (stream GetStorageCommandResponse) {}
      Request: message StorageDataCommandRequest {
      string file_name=1;
      .generic.CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      file_name Filename(.rec) under which the data has to be stored
      Response: message GetStorageCommandResponse {
      bytes data = 1;
      string file_name = 2;
      int64 file_size = 3;
      .generic.CommandResponse cmd_response = 4;
      }
      Parameter Description
      data File contents of the point cloud data
      file-name Name under which the file has to be saved
      File_size File size
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GetStorageData GOCATOR_1 storage_data.rec

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetStoredValues: API called to the Gocator through CLI Command
      • GOCATOR_1: Alias name of the Gocator device

    14. GoStartData

      Description for GoStartData API: To start the data function.
      RPC Command: rpc GoStartData(.generic.CommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GoStartData GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GoStartData: Name of the API
      • GOCATOR_1: Aliased Name for Gocator 2350

    15. GoStopData

      Description for GoStopData API: To stop the data function.
      RPC Command: rpc GoStopData(.generic.CommandRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python gocator.py GoStopData GOCATOR_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GoStopData: Name of the API
      • GOCATOR_1: Aliased Name for Gocator 2350

    Limitations of the driver

    • Compatibility: The driver may only be compatible with Gocator, limiting its use with other devices.
    • Integration: Integrating the driver with other systems or software may pose challenges, especially if there are compatibility issues or dependencies.

    Testing and Debugging

    Code Description
    FFFFFC18 Operation cannot be completed in the current state.,Gocator,
    FFFFFC19 Item was not found
    FFFFFC1A Command was not recognized.
    FFFFFC1B Parameter was not valid
    FFFFFC1C Feature is not implemented
    FFFFFC1E Out of memory
    FFFFFC1F Action timed out.,
    FFFFFC20 Data incomplete (e.g. buffer insufficient for results)
    FFFFFC21 Error in communication stream (e.g. network, file)
    FFFFFC22 Resource is no longer available.
    FFFFFC23 Incompatible version
    FFFFFC24 Operation aborted
    FFFFFC25 Request conflicts with existing item
    FFFFFC26 Network setup/resource error
    FFFFFC27 Heap error (leak/double-free)
    FFFFFC28 Data parsing/formatting error
    FFFFFC29 Object is read-only (cannot be written)
    FFFFFC2A Object is write-only (cannot be read)
    FFFFFC2B Agent is busy (cannot service request)
    FFFFFC2C Current state has one or more configuration or resource conflicts
    FFFFFC2D Generic error reported by underlying OS
    FFFFFC2E Hardware device error
    FFFFFC2F Resource is already fully utilized.
    FFFFFC30 Operation is in progress, but not yet complete
    0 General error
    1 Operation successful

    RESOURCES AND LINKS

    • GoSDK Setup ND Demo: Demo link
    • Manual: Manual link

    GLOSSARY

    • Gocator: A family of 3D smart sensors manufactured by LMI Technologies, used for inline inspection, measurement, and quality control in industrial applications.
    • 3D Point Cloud: A set of data points in a three-dimensional coordinate system that represents the external surface of an object scanned by a 3D sensor, such as the Gocator.
    • Field of View (FOV): The area that a sensor can capture or observe at any given moment. It is typically defined by the sensor's lens and sensor size.
    • Resolution: The smallest detectable change in position or dimension that a sensor can measure. Higher resolution sensors can detect smaller features.
    • Scan Rate: The speed at which a sensor captures and processes data. It is usually measured in Hz or frames per second (FPS).
    • Measurement Range: The range of distances over which a sensor can accurately measure objects. It is typically defined by the sensor's optics and laser.
    • Profile: A 2D cross-section of a 3D object captured by the sensor. Gocator sensors often capture profiles along a line to build a 3D point cloud.
    • ROI (Region of Interest): A specific area within the sensor's field of view where measurements or inspections are performed.
    • Calibration: The process of adjusting a sensor to ensure that its measurements are accurate and consistent. Calibration is often necessary to correct for distortions or misalignments.
    • Alignment: The process of adjusting the sensor's position or orientation to ensure that it is correctly aligned with the object being scanned.

    SC10 Driver Document

    Introduction

    Brief overview of the project

    TThis project focuses on developing drivers for SC10(Safety Controller) to be utilized in automation applications, with a particular emphasis on integrating them with a user interface (UI) application for future use. The project aims to create software components that enable seamless communication between SC10, allowing for intuitive control and monitoring of the IO systems. Through this integration, the project seeks to enhance the usability and functionality of SC10 Relay within automated processes, contributing to increased efficiency and productivity in various industrial settings.

    Purpose of the document

    The purpose of this document is to provide a detailed guide for developing a driver for the SC10 device. The driver will enable communication between the SC10 module and external software applications. It covers the software development process, including setting up the development environment, implementing the driver, testing and debugging, and integrating the driver with the SC10 device.

    The primary objective of the document is to provide a comprehensive guide for developed drivers for SC10 used in automation using a UI application. This includes detailed instructions, code examples, and best practices to ensure the successful development and integration of drivers with the devices.

    Scope and objectives

    1. Driver Development: The document focuses on the development of a driver for SC10 device.
    2. Technical Information: It includes technical specifications of the device, hardware and software requirements, and information about the Software Development Kit (SDK) provided for the device.
    3. SDK Overview: Banner Engineering is the SDK for the SC10.In that we can see that connected input list and output list status of the those Input and output.
    4. Driver Implementation: It covers the development process, including the choice of programming language, information on APIs, how to use APIs, limitations of the driver, precautions to take before execution, and the actual implementation of the driver.
    5. Testing and Debugging: The scope extends to testing and debugging procedures to ensure the reliability and functionality of the driver.
    6. Documentation and Support: Lastly, the document includes information on documentation standards and support resources available for developers.
      7. Overall, the aim is to facilitate the successful development and implementation of the SC10 driver, ensuring it meets the required standards and serves its intended purpose effectively.

    Device Overview

    Description of the device for which the driver is being developed

    The SC10 configurable safety relay controller is an easy-to-use and cost-effective alternative to safety relay modules. It replaces the functionality and capability of two independent safety relay modules while offering the configurability, simplicity, and advanced diagnostics capabilities offered by the rest of the Banner Engineering Safety Controller line-up.


    • In-Series Diagnostics (ISD) provides detailed status and performance data from each connected safety device which can be accessed with an HMI or similar device.
    • Intuitive, icon-based programming with drag-and-drop PC configuration simplifies device setup and management.
    • Supports a wide range of safety devices, eliminating the need to buy and stock safety relay modules dedicated to specific safety devices.
    • Two six-amp safety relay outputs, each with three normally open (NO) sets of contacts • Ten inputs, including four that can be used as non-safe outputs.
    • Automatic Terminal Optimization (ATO) can increase the inputs from 10 to up to 14 • Industrial Ethernet two-way communication.
    • 256 virtual non-safe status outputs
    • 80 virtual non-safe inputs (reset, ON/OFF, cancel OFF delay, mute enable)

    Technical Specifications

    LAN Communication Setting

    The settable items consist of the following three types:

    • IP Address
    • Subnet Mask
    • Default Gateway

    Hardware and Software Requirements

    Hardware specifications of SC10

    Model SC10
    Power 24V DC 100mA (no load)
    Protocols EtherNet /IP, Modbus TCP,PROFINET
    Safety Inputs Input ON threshold: > 15 V DC (guaranteed on), 30 V DC max.
    Input OFF threshold: < 5 V DC and < 2 mA, –3 V DC min.
    Input ON current: 5 mA typical at 24 V DC, 50 mA peak contact cleaning current at 24 V DC
    Input lead resistance: 300 Ω max. (150 Ω per lead)
    Output Protection All solid-state outputs (safety and non-safety) are protected from shorts to 0 V or +24 V, including overcurrent conditions

    Software Requirement

    • Microsoft Visual Studio for Python IDE for development
    • Additional software or libraries required by the SDK or application

    Software Overview

    The Banner SC10 Safety Controller Software is specifically designed to configure, monitor, and manage the SC10 Safety Controller, a compact and efficient device used for integrating safety functions in industrial automation systems. This software enables users to set up and validate safety circuits, monitor device status, and ensure compliance with safety standards, making it an essential tool for ensuring workplace safety and operational efficiency.
    Banner software is compatible with the XS26 Series, SC26 Series, and SC10 Series safety controllers from Banner Engineering.
    The following safety controller products are compatible with the safety controller software.

    • In-Series Diagnostics
    • XS 26 Series
    • SC26 Series
    • SC10 Series

    Driver Development

    Introduction to driver development for the device

    The driver development consists of three key components:

    • SC10.py

      • SC10.py serves as the core interface, offering modbus programming that plays crucial role in establishing communication between the software and SC10 devices. This code provides the all scratch code for the required API.

    • SC10_driver.py

      • SC10_driver.py It provides APIs to connect to the device, send and receive packets, and encode/decode data according to the modbus protocol. This code enables the minimum functionalities of the API by waymo.

    • DeviceDetails.py

      • The DeviceDetails.py file reads the .xsc file and segregate and provide the input device and output device list and the respective device bit number as well.

    Choice of Programing Language

    For developing the driver we have used Python. Python 3 will support for the SC10

    Driver Implementation

    1. Get Device Details
    2. Open Device
    3. Close Device
    4. Change Alias
    5. GetinputDeviceList
    6. GetOutputDeviceList
    7. GetInputDevStatus
    8. GetOutputDevStatus

    gRPC API’s Description for SC10 Device

    1. GetDeviceDetails

      Description for GetDeviceDetails API: Retrieves detailed information about the connected SC10, including its configuration and status.

      RPC Command : rpc GetDeviceDetails(.generic. CommandRequest) returns (.generic.GenericDeviceModel) {}

      Request:
      message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Request:
      message GenericDeviceModel{
      string instance_id = 1;
      string device_alias = 2;
      DeviceType device_type = 3;
      DeviceModel device_model_name = 4;
      optional DeviceStatus device_status = 5;
      string ipaddr = 6;
      string mac_addr = 7;
      google.protobuf.Value conn_handle=8;
      string port_name = 9;
      int64 port_address = 10;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 11;
      }
      Parameter Description
      instance_id New instance for the device in the enumeration
      device_alias Unique identifier (alphanumeric) for every device in the enumeration
      device_type Indicates the type of device like Motion stage, Safety Controller etc (defined below in the DeviceType enum)
      device_model_name Indicate the model name for each device (define below in the DeviceModel enum)
      device_status Indicate whether the device is online , offline or not reachable (define below in the device status enum)
      ipaddr indicate the ipaddress of the device
      mac_addr Indicate the mac address of the device
      Conn_handle Handle object to keep the device open
      port_name Port name of the device
      port_address Port address of the device
      cmd_response Indicates command response that describes API response code and its description (Defined below in CommandResponse)
      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Unique alias of the device
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python sc10.py GetDeviceDetails SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetDeviceDetails: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • SC10_1: Aliased Name for SC10

    2. OpenDevice

      Description for OpenDevice API: Establishes connection with SC10, initializing communication for further operations.

      RPC Command : rpc OpenDevice(.generic.CommandIPRequest) returns(.generic.GenericDeviceModel) {}

      Request:
      message CommandIPRequest{
      string ip_address = 1;
      string com=2;
      int64 port_address=3;
      int32 device_id = 4;
      string file_path = 5;
      int64 device_model =6;
      optional string device_alias=7;
      int32 axis =8;
      }
      Parameter Description
      ip_address IP Address of the Device
      port_address Port address of the device
      Response
      message GenericDeviceModel{
      string instance_id = 1;
      string device_alias = 2;
      DeviceType device_type = 3;
      DeviceModel device_model_name = 4;
      optional DeviceStatus device_status = 5;
      string ipaddr = 6;
      string mac_addr = 7;
      google.protobuf.Value conn_handle=8;
      string port_name = 9;
      int64 port_address = 10;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 11;
      }
      Parameter Description
      instance_id New instance for the device in the enumeration
      device_alias Unique identifier (alphanumeric) for every device in the enumeration
      device_type Indicates the type of device like Motion stage, Safety Controller etc (defined below in the DeviceType enum)
      device_model_name Indicate the model name for each device (define below in the DeviceModel enum)
      device_status Indicate whether the device is online , offline or not reachable (define below in the device status enum)
      ipaddr indicate the ipaddress of the device
      mac_addr Indicate the mac address of the device
      Conn_handle Handle object to keep the device open
      port_name Port name of the device
      port_address Port address of the device
      cmd_response Indicates command response that describes API response code and its description (Defined below in CommandResponse)

      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      ParameterParameter
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python sc10.py OpenDevice 192.168.127.10 502 D:\NewFolder\new.xsc

      Description for CLI Command
      • OpenDevice: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command to connect and initialize all resources
      • 192.168.127.10: IP Address of the device
      • 502: Port Number
      • D:\NewFolder\new.xsc .Xsc file path

    3. CloseDevice

      Description for CloseDevice API: Disconnects from the SC10, releasing all resources and deleting associated handlers to ensure a clean shutdown.
      RPC Command: rpc CloseDevice(.generic.CommandRequest) returns(.generic.CommandResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python sc10.py CloseDevice SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • CloseDevice: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command to Close device Connection
      • SC10_1: Aliased Name for SC10

    4. ChangeAlias

      Description for ChangeAlias API: Updates the alias of the device, allowing it to be referenced by a new identifier.
      RPC Command: rpc changeAlias(ChangeAliasRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {} Request: message ChangeAliasRequest{
      string current_alias=1;
      string new_alias=2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      current_alias current_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      new_alias The device_alias to change to
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code

      CLI Command: python SC10.py ChangeAlias current_alias new_alias

      Description for CLI Command:
      • ChangeAlias: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • current_alias: The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      • new_alias: The device_alias to change to

    5. GetInputDeviceList

      Description for GetInputDeviceList API: API to retrieve a list of all input devices connected to the SC10 Safety Controller.
      RPC Command: rpc GetInputDeviceList (.genric.CommandRequest) returns (ReadInputDeviceListResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest{
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message ReadInputDeviceListResponse {
      repeated InputDeviceList = 1;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      message InputDeviceList{
      string name = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code
      InputDeviceList List of Connected Input devices to SC10
      name Name of the input device

      CLI Command: python sc10.py GetInputDeviceList SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetInputDeviceList:API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • SC10_1: Aliased name of the Device

    6. GetOutputDeviceList

      Description for GetOutputDeviceList API: API to retrieve a list of all output devices connected to the SC10 Safety Controller.
      RPC Command: rpc GetOutputDeviceList (.genric.CommandRequest) returns (ReadOutputDeviceListResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device obtained from enumeration API
      Response: message ReadOutputsDeviceListResponse {
      repeated OutputDeviceList = 1;
      .generic.CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      message OutputDeviceList {
      string name = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code
      OutputDeviceList List of the connected output device to SC10
      Name Name of the output device

      CLI Command: python sc10.py GetOutputDeviceList SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetOutputDeviceList: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • SC10_1: Aliased Name for device

    7. GetInputDevStatus

      Description for GetInputDevStatus API: API to retrive the current status of the Input device.
      RPC Command: rpc GetInputDevStatus(CommandRequest) returns(ReadInputStatusResponse) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest
      {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Name of the device
      Response: message ReadInputStatusResponse {
      repeated InputDeviceList = 1;
      generic.CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      message InputDeviceList {
      string resp_description = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code
      Name Name of the device
      InputDeviceList Status of Input devices connected to SC10

      CLI Command: python sc10.py GetInputDeviceStatus SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetInputDeviceStatus: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • SC10_1: Aliased Name for SC10

    8. GetOutputDevStatus

      Description for GetOutputDevStatus API: GetOutputStatus API will read the status of the output device of SC10.
      RPC Command: rpc GetOutputStatus(CommandRequest) returns(ReadOutputStatusRespons) {}
      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device obtained from enumeration API
      Response: message ReadOutputStatusRespons {
      repeated OutputDeviceList = 1;
      .generic.CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_description = 2;
      }
      message OutputDeviceList {
      string name = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      OutputDeviceList Status of output devices connected to SC10
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_description Description of the response code
      Name Name of the output device

      CLI Command: python sc10.py GetOutputDeviceStatus SC10_1

      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetOutputDeviceStatus: API called to the SC10 through CLI Command
      • SC10_1: Aliased Name for device

      9. Limitations of the driver

      • Compatibility: The driver only supports the SC10 Module not work with other module.
      • Integration:Integrating the driver with other systems or software may pose challenges, especially if there are compatibility issues or dependencies.

      Precautions to take before executing the driver

      • Make sure the Device is in connected with the station
      • Ensure to giving the valid channel number and state.

    TESTING AND DEBUGING:

    SNMP commands
    Issues Cause Solution
    Unable to read device properly The loaded .xsc file might be wrong. Check the .xsc file in the driver folder.
    Unable to communicate with a device. IP address is might be wrong. Check the IP address of the device give it correctly.
    Not getting the output or Input device status. The loaded .xsc file might be wrong or Connection is wrong might be. Check the .xsc file if it is having those device list and Check the input device and output device connection.
    .Xsc file not available error The given folder might be wrong. Check and give the correct folder name which having correct .xsc file.

    RESOURCES AND LINKS

    • SC10 Manual: https://info.bannerengineering.com/cs/groups/public/documents/literature/174868.pdf

    GLOSSARY

    • API (Application Programming Interface): Set of protocols, tools, and definitions that allow software applications to communicate and interact with the SC10 driver.
    • Command: Instruction or directive sent to a SC10 I/O through the driver to perform specific actions such as movement, I/O control, or program execution.
    • Response: Feedback or acknowledgment received from the SC10 I/O after executing a command, indicating the success or failure of the operation and providing relevant information or data.
    • I/O (Input/Output):: Interface for interacting with external devices or sensors connected to the SC10 device, allowing the driver to control outputs.
    • .xsc file This is the configuration file which taken from the banner software.

    Alio ACS Motion Stage Controller Driver Development Guide

    Introduction

    Brief overview of the project

    This project focuses on developing drivers for the Alio Stage utilizing the ACS motion controller in automation applications. The primary goal is to achieve seamless integration with a user interface (UI) for potential future use, facilitating precise motion control and positioning.

    The ACS motion controller is responsible for powering the motors and managing movement across each axis. Key functionalities include trajectory planning, velocity profiling, and synchronization, ensuring smooth and accurate control of motion. The successful integration of these drivers will enhance the usability of the ACS motion controller in automated workflows, increasing efficiency and productivity across various industrial applications.

    Purpose of the document

    The purpose of this document is to provide a comprehensive guide for developed drivers for the Alio 3-axis stage (X, Y, R) and the Alio single-axis stage (R), using the ACS motion controller (specifically the SPiiPlusEC controller and UDMNT amplifier). The drivers will facilitate communication between the motor and external software applications, enabling precise control over various parameters such as position, velocity, acceleration, direction, Return home functionality etc..

    The primary objective of the document is to provide a comprehensive guide for developed drivers Alio 3 axis stage (X,Y,R) and Alio single-axis stage (R) using ACS motion controller (SPiiPlusEC controller and UDMNT amplifier) used in automation using a UI application. This includes detailed instructions, software installation guide, a device description with its features, and best practices to ensure the successful development and integration of drivers with the devices.

    Scope and objectives

    1. Driver Development: The document focuses on the development of a driver for Alio 3 axis stage (X, Y,R) and Alio Single Axis (R) using ACS motion controller using industry-standard protocols.
    2. Technical Information: It provides the technical specifications of Alio, hardware and software requirements, and detailed information about the Software Development Kit (SDK) provided for the device.
    3. SDK Overview: Introduction to SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio, covering the installation process and usage of these tools for development.
    4. Driver Implementation: This section covers the driver development process, including the selection of a suitable programming language, usage of APIs for interacting with the Alio ACS, limitations of the driver, necessary precautions before execution, and the actual implementation strategy.
    5. Testing and Debugging: The scope extends to testing and debugging methodologies, ensuring the driver performs reliably and meets the required performance standards in real-time automation scenarios.
    6. Documentation and Support: This document provides information about documentation standards for the development process and available support resources for developers working on integrating the driver with the Alio ACS Motion Stage Controller.

    Overall, the aim is to facilitate the successful development and implementation of the Alio 3 axis stage (X, Y,R) and Alio 1 axis stage (R) using ACS motion controller, ensuring it meets the required standards and serves its intended purpose effectively.

    Device Overview

    ACS Motion Control is a global manufacturer of high-performance machine control systems for demanding motion centric applications.

    Features of ACS Motion Control:SPiiPlusEC

    SPiiPlusEC is a cutting-edge motion controller and EtherCAT network manager designed to optimize performance and integration for motion control systems. Key features include:

    • ACS SPiiPlusEC is a state-of-the-art line of Motion controllers and EtherCAT master
    • Controller Application Development
    • Host Application Development
    • Motion Profile Generation
    • Motion-to-Process Synchronization
    • PLC and PAC Integration
    • Machine Safety and Uptime

    Technical Specifications of SPiiPlusEC

    Type Motion controller
    Number of Axes Up to 64 axes, Thousands of I/O’s
    Programming

    ACSPL+ powerful motion language - Real-time program(s) execution - Up to 64 simultaneously running programs:

    • IEC61131-3 (PLC) languages: IL, ST, LD, FBD, SFC
    • NC programs (G-code)
    • C/C++, .NET and many others standard languages
    Communication Channels

    Serial: two RS-232. Up to 115,200 bps

    Ethernet: One, TCP/IP, 100/1000 Mbps Simultaneous communication through all channels is fully supported. Modbus as master or slave is supported over Ethernet and serial channels. Ethernet/IP protocol as adapter is supported over Ethernet channel.
    Power Supply 24Vdc ± 10%, 0.8A
    Environment

    Operating Temperature: 0°C to 55°C

    An internal fan is automatically activated when operating temperature rises above 30°C

    Storage Temperature: -20°C to 85°C

    Humidity: 90%RH, non-condensing

    EtherCAT ports

    Two ports, Primary and secondary

    Rate: 100 Mbit/sec

    Protocols: CoE and FoE

    NetworkBoost™ (optional) : Automatic network failure detection and recovery using ring topology and redundancy ring topology and redundancy

    Servo Performance:

    • A standard comprehensive set of powerful algorithms to enhance accuracy, move & settle time, smooth velocity, stability and robustness.
    • Advanced PIV cascaded structure
    • Loop shaping filters
    • Gain Scheduling
    • Gantry MIMO control
    • Dual feedback / loop control
    • Disturbance rejection control › Optional Servoboost™ algorithm that provides better, more consistent servo performance, insensitive to noise and large changes in the system.

    Universal driver:

    • 2 and 3 phase AC Servo / DC brushless with sinusoidal commutation • DC Brush • Voice coils
    • Closed and open loop step motors
    • 12Vdc to 80Vdc, up to 10A continuous and 20A peak current
    • Wide range of feedback interfaces:
      • Digital incremental encoders
      • Sin-Cos analog encoder interface, supporting laser encoders with speeds >10MHz (optional)
      • Absolute encoders (optional) EnDat 2.1(digital)/2.2, Smart- Abs, Panasonic, BiSS-C

    Comprehensive I/O:

    • 4 general-purpose / Registration MARK inputs
    • 2 general purpose / motor brake outputs (24V, 0.1A)
    • 2 PEG (Position Event Generator) outputs
    • 2 analog inputs, ±10V
    • 1 analog output, ±10V

    Software Overview and Requirements - SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio Suite 2.28 or 3.14

    All SPiiPlus motion control products use the same software (firmware for controller, high-level language libraries for host programs, and Windows-based tools for host-based controller setup and controller program development)

    Features Of SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio Suite 2.28 or 3.14

    • Powerful Platform Designed for Performance
    • High Level Integration, Enhancing Accuracy & Throughput
    • Nanometer Positioning and High Velocities
    • The Most Accurate and Flexible Gantry Control
    • SPiiPlus Library - API for Host Programming

    Hardware and Software Requirements

    Hardware / System Requirements:

    SPiiPlus SDK Suite Version 2.30 supports the following Microsoft® Windows environments:

    • Windows XP SP2 (64 bit)
    • Windows XP SP3 (32 bit)
    • Windows 7 (32 bit and 64 bit)
    • Windows 8.1 (32 bit and 64 bit)
    • Windows Server 2012 (64 bit)
    • Windows 10 (32 bit and 64 bit)

    Software Requirements:

    • SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio 2.28 or 3.14 Software Suite
    • Microsoft Visual Studio for C++ IDE for development
    • Additional software or libraries required by the SDK or application

    Additional Requirements:

    This version of Microsoft Visual Studio works best with Internet Explorer 10 or higher. If Internet Explorer 10 is not installed on your computer, some features might not work as expected

    Installing Software

    This topic explains how to install the SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio 2.28 for Windows.

    SPiiPlus Installation Disk

    The SPiiPlus MMI Application Suite installation CD includes:

    Firmware -System-level software that runs on the controller's MPU (motion processing unit). The version of the firmware is identical to the version of the SPiiPlus CD installation and supplied for maintenance/backup purposes. Each product is provided by ACS with the most updated firmware released version (unless otherwise is required).

    SPiiPlus MMI Application Studio -Windows-based software tool for configuring, adjusting, programming and monitoring the motion.

    SPiiPlus Simulator -Windows-based controller simulator that runs on the PC without any connected hardware.

    Application Studio and be used to debug programs and to simulate motion trajectory (with zero following error), inputs, outputs and faults.

    SPiiPlus Utilities -The SPiiPlus UMD (User Mode Driver), which provides the communication link between the host computer and the motion controller.

    SPiiPlus Documentation -Data sheets and user guides documentation for the SPiiPlus products. All the documents are in PDF format.

    Software Installation

    To install the SPiiPlus software package:

    1. Insert the SPiiPlus MMI Application Suite installation CD into the PC.

    2. Follow the on-screen installation instructions.

    Driver Development

    Users of the Smart Motor Interface Software Suite may want to build their own C++ applications without the need to purchase an integrated development environment (IDE). This application note describes an alternative way to build C++ applications using free Microsoft Visual Studio.

    Microsoft stopped providing single-language programming environments. Therefore, it is necessary to install the complete edition of free Microsoft Visual Studio. This will automatically enable you to build C++ applications with .NET languages such as C# and Visual Basic (*) as well, which are also supported by the Smart Motor Interfaces Software Suite.

    The following two free Microsoft Visual Studio tools are applicable to build pylon-based C++ applications:

    • Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop does not provide the x64 native compiler. However, you can build 64-bit executables just fine using the x86-x64 cross compiler running on WOW64.
    • Microsoft Visual Studio Community Microsoft Visual Studio Community is the successor of the Express Edition starting with the 2015 release, but is also available in a 2013 release. It is comparable in its functionality to the full Professional Edition.

    To get an overview of the Visual C++ features available in Microsoft Visual Studio, refer to the followinglink

    Steps To Be Carried Out

    To build powerful Windows ACS motion controller applications carry out the following steps:

    1. Install the desired free Microsoft Visual Studio tool.
    2. Prepare the C++ projects.
    3. Run the project.

    DRIVER DEVELOPMENT

    The following drivers or APIs are developed and tested

    1. ACSOpen
    2. ACSClose
    3. Get Device Details
    4. Change Alias
    5. Get Position
    6. Get Velocity
    7. Set Velocity
    8. Set Acceleration
    9. Get Acceleration
    10. Run Buffer Program
    11. Enable Motor
    12. Disable Motor
    13. Get Current Status of Motor
    14. Perform PTP Movement-(Absolute and Relative PTP Movement)

    gRPC API’s Description for Alio ACS

    1. ACSOpen

      Description for ACSOpen API: Establishes a connection to the Alio ACS, enabling communication and control.

      RPC Command :rpc OpenDevice(.generic.CommandIPRequest) returns(.generic.GenericDeviceModel) {}

      Request:
      message CommandIPRequest {
      string ip_address = 1;
      string com = 2;
      int64 port_address = 3;
      int32 device_id = 4;
      string file_path = 5;
      int64 device_model =6;
      optional string device_alias=7;
      int32 axis =8;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      ip_address Specifies the IP address of the device.
      com Indicates the communication protocol or interface to be used
      port_address Denotes the specific port address for the device on the communication interface.
      device_id Unique identifier for the device, used to distinguish it from other devices in the system.
      file_path The path to the file, which may include configuration, program, or data files for the device.
      device_model Represents the model number or type of the device being communicated with.
      device_alias A user-defined alias for the device, providing a more descriptive or convenient reference.
      axis Specifies the axis number (e.g., X, Y, Z) on which the command or operation will be performed.
      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Response message code
      Response
      message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Response Message
      CLI Command: python alioacs.py ACSOpen 100.0.0.1 18 3 ALIO_ACS_1
      Description for CLI Command
      • OpenDevice: API called to the Alio ACS through CLI Command to connect and initialize all resources
      • 100.0.0.1: IP Address of the device
      • 18: Enum value representing the device type (18 for 3-Axis Alio, 6 for Single-Axis Alio).
      • 3:Specifies that it is a 3-Axis Alio (0 for Single-Axis Alio).

    2. GetDeviceDetails

      Description for GetDeviceDetails API:Retrieves detailed information about the Alio-ACS controller.

      RPC Command : rpc GetDeviceDetails(CommandRequest) returns (GenericDeviceModel) {}

      Request: message CommandRequest {
      string device_alias = 1;
      }
      Parameter Description
      device_alias Unique alias of the device
      Response:
      message GenericDeviceModel{
      string instance_id = 1;
      string device_alias = 2;
      DeviceType device_type = 3;
      DeviceModel device_model_name = 4;
      optional DeviceStatus device_status = 5;
      string ipaddr = 6;
      string mac_addr = 7;
      google.protobuf.Value conn_handle=8;
      string port_name = 9;
      int64 port_address = 10;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 11;
      }
      Parameter Description
      instance_id New instance for the device in the enumeration
      device_alias Unique identifier (alphanumeric) for every device in the enumeration
      device_type Indicates the type of device like Motion stage, Safety Controller etc (defined below in the DeviceType enum)
      device_model_name Indicate the model name for each device (define below in the DeviceModel enum)
      device_status Indicate whether the device is online , offline or not reachable (define below in the device status enum)
      ipaddr Indicate the ipaddress of the device
      mac_addr Indicate the mac address of the device
      Conn_handle Handle object to keep the device open
      port_name Port name
      port_address Port address
      cmd_response Indicates command response that describes API response code and its description (Defined below in CommandResponse)
      enum DeviceType{
      NONE = 0;
      SENSOR_3D = 1;
      MOTION_STAGE = 2;
      CAMERA = 3;
      IO_MODULE = 4;
      SAFETY_CONTROLLER = 5;
      ANIMATIC_MOTOR=6;
      }
      enum DeviceModel{
      DUMMY_MODEL = 0;
      ED527 = 1;
      ED588 = 2 ;
      JR3000 = 3;
      OPTOE = 4;
      BASLER = 5;
      SPiiPlusEC=6;
      GT6600 = 7;
      MOTOR = 8;
      }
      enum DeviceStatus{
      OFFLINE = 0;
      ONLINE = 1;
      NOT_REACHABLE =2;
      }
      message CommandResponse{
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Response message code
      CLI Command: python alioacs.py GetDeviceDetails ALIO_ACS_1
      Description for CLI Command:
      • GetDeviceDetails: API called to retrieve details of the Alio-ACS controller through a CLI command.
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias Name of the ACS controller

    3. ChangeAlias

      Description for ChangeAlias API: Updates the alias of the device, allowing it to be referenced by a new identifier.

      RPC Command: rpc changeAlias(ChangeAliasRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message ChangeAliasRequest{
      string current_alias=1;
      string new_alias=2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      current_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      new_alias The device_alias to change to
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Response message code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py ChangeAlias current_alias new_alias
        Description for CLI Command:
      • ChangeAlias: API called to the Alio through CLI Command to get new alias name
      • current_alias: The current device_alias used to refer to the device
      • new_alias: The device_alias to change to

    4. Get Position

      Description of the API: Retrieves the current position of the specified axis on the Alio-ACS device.

      RPC Command: rpc GetPosition(AxisCommandRequest) returns (GetPositionResponse) {}

      Request: message AxisCommandRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the operation is requested
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message GetPositionResponse {
      optional double position = 1;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      position Position co-ordinate in mm or deg
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Response message code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py GetPosition ALIO_ACS_1 0

      Description for CLI Command:

      • GetPosition:API called to the Alio through CLI Command Retrive Current Position of the specified motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the position has to be fetched (Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2)for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted values :rotary axis - 0)for Single Axis Alio

    5. GetVelocity

      Description of the API: Retrieves the current velocity of the specified axis on the Alio-ACS device.

      RPC Command: rpc GetVelocity(AxisCommandRequest) returns (GetVelocityResponse) {}

      Request: message AxisCommandRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the operation is requested
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message GetVelocityResponse {
      optional double velocity = 1;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      velocity Current velocity of the specified axis in mm/s or deg/s
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py GetVelocity ALIO_ACS_1 0

      Description for CLI Command:

      • GetVelocity:API called to the Alio through CLI Command Retrive Current Velocity of the specified motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis from which the velocity has to be fetched (Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted values: rotary axis - 0)for Single Axis Alio

    6. Set Velocity

      Description of the API: Sets the Velocity for the Motor of specified axis

      RPC Command: rpc SetVelocity(SetVelocityRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message SetVelocityRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      double velocity = 2;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 4;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the velocity is to be set
      Accel Acceleration to be set for the specified axis movement in units of mm/s for linear motor and deg/s for rotary motor
      Decel Deceleration to be set for the specified axis movement in units of mm/s and deg/s for rotary motor
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py SetVelocity ALIO_ACS_1 0 30

      Description for CLI Command:

      • SetVelocity: API called to the Alio through CLI Command to Set Velocity of the specified motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the velocity has to be set(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2)for 3 Axis Alio and(Permitted values: rotary axis -0)
      • 30: Velocity in mm/s units for linear motor and deg/s for rotary motor

    7. Get Acceleration

      Description of the API: Retrieves the current acceleration and deceleration values for the specified axis of the Alio-ACS device.

      RPC Command: rpc GetAcceleration (AxisCommandRequest) returns (GetAccelerationResponse) {}

      Request: message AxisCommandRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the operation is requested
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message GetAccelerationResponse {
      optional double acceleration = 1;
      optional double decelaration = 2;
      CommandResponse cmd_response = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      acceleration Current acceleration
      decelaration Current deceleration
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message Response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py GetAcceleration ALIO_ACS_1 0

      Description for CLI Command:

      • GetAcceleration: API called to the Alio through CLI Command to Retrive Current Acceleration of specified motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the acceleration has to be fetched(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted values : rotary axis -0) for Single Axis Alio.

    8. Set Acceleration

      Description of the API: Configures the Acceleration for the motor on the specified axis of the Alio-ACS device.

      RPC Command: rpc SetAcceleration(SetAccelerationRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message SetAccelerationRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      double accel = 2;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the acceleration has to be set (0,1,2) for 3 Axis Alio and (0)for Single Axis Alio
      Accel Acceleration to be set for the specified axis movement in units of mm/s2 for Linear Motor and deg/s2 for Rotary Motor
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message Response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py SetAcceleration ALIO_ACS_1 0 30

      Description for CLI Command:

      • SetAcceleration:API called to the Alio through CLI Command to Set Acceleration of the specified motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the acceleration has to be set(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted values: rotary axis - 0) for Single Axis Alio.
      • 30: Acceleration in mm/s2 units for Linear Motor and deg/s2 for Rotary Motor.

    9. Perform Ptp Movement- Absolute PTP Motion

      Description of the API: Initiates a Point-to-Point (PTP) motion to move the motor to a specified absolute position within its defined range, ensuring precise and controlled movement.

      RPC Command: rpc AbsolutePTPMotion(PTPMotionRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message PTPMotionRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      double position = 2;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Specifies the axis for which the PTP movement is to be executed. (0, 1, 2 for 3-axis Alio, 0 for Single Axis Alio).
      position Defines the target position to which the motor should move. The value is typically given in millimeters or degrees, depending on the motor type.
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py AbsolutePtpMovementControl ACS_Alio 0 20

      Description for CLI Command:

      • AbsolutePtpMovementControl: API called to Alio through CLI Command for executing a Point-to-Point (PTP) movement to move the motor to a specified absolute position on the specified axis of the Alio system.
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the acceleration has to be fetched(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted value: rotary axis - 0) for Single Axis Alio.
      • 20: The relative position to which the motor has to move in mm for Linear Motor and deg for Rotary Motor

    10. Perform Ptp Movement- Relative PTP Motion

      Description of the API: Initiates a Point-to-Point (PTP) motion to move the motor to a specified relative position from its current location, ensuring precise and controlled movement.

      RPC Command: rpc RelativePTPMotion(PTPMotionRequest) returns (.generic.CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message PTPMotionRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      double position = 2;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Specifies the axis for which the PTP movement is to be executed. (0, 1, 2 for 3-axis Alio, 0 for Single Axis Alio).
      position Defines the target position to which the motor should move relative to current position. The value is typically given in millimeters or degrees, depending on the motor type.
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py RelativePtpMovementControl ACS_Alio 0 20

      Description for CLI Command:

      • RelativePtpMovementControl: API called to Alio through CLI Command for executing a Point-to-Point (PTP) movement to move the motor to a specified position relative to current position on the specified axis of the Alio system.
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: The axis for which the acceleration has to be fetched(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted value: rotary axis - 0) for Single Axis Alio.
      • 20: The relative position to which the motor has to move in mm for Linear Motor and deg for Rotary Motor

    11. Run Buffer Program

      Description of the API: Executes the program stored in the specified buffer number on the Alio system.

      RPC Command: rpc RunBufferProgram(RunBufferProgramRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message RunBufferProgramRequest {
      int32 buffer_num = 1;
      optional string ip_address=2;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 3;
      }
      Parameter Description
      buffer_num The buffer program to execute (0,1,2...)
      ip_address Ip address of he device
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command:python alioacs.py RunBufferProgram ALIO_ACS_1 1

      Description for CLI Command:

      • RunBufferProgram: API called to Alio through CLI Command for executing program from the specified buffer.
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 1: The buffer number from which the program has to run

    12. Enable Motor

      Description of the API: To Enable the motor of the specified axis

      RPC Command: rpc EnableMotor(AxisCommandRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message AxisCommandRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the operation is requested
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command: python alioacs.py EnableMotor ALIO_ACS_1 0

      Description for CLI Command:

      • EnableMotor: API called to Alio through CLI Command to Enable the specified Motor
      • ALIO_ACS_1: Alias of the Device
      • 0: the axis for which the acceleration has to be fetched(Permitted values: x-axis - 0, y-axis - 1, rotary axis - 2) for 3 Axis Alio and (Permitted values: rotary axis -0) for Single Axis Alio.

    13. Disable Motor

      Description of the API: To Disable the motor of the specified axis

      RPC Command: rpc DisableMotor(AxisCommandRequest) returns (CommandResponse) {}

      Request: message AxisCommandRequest {
      int32 axis = 1;
      CommandRequest cmd_request = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      axis Axis for which the operation is requested
      device_alias The unique device_alias used to refer the device
      Response: message CommandResponse {
      int32 resp_code = 1;
      string resp_message = 2;
      }
      Parameter Description
      resp_code Response code from the device API
      resp_message Message response code
      CLI Command: python alioacs.py DisableMotor ALIO_ACS_1 0

      Description for CLI Command:
